DataElement.preferredName: Patient History Verification Invasive Fungal Infection Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not there is a history of proven invasive fungal infection.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient History Verification Invasive Fungal Infection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events._Supported or established by evidence or proof._Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue._An infection caused by eukaryotic heterotrophic organisms that live as saprobes or parasites, including mushrooms, yeasts, smuts, molds, etc. They reproduce either sexually or asexually, and have life cycles that range from simple to complex. Filamentous fungi refer to those that grow as multicellular colonies (mushrooms and molds).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.:The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.

Property.preferredDefinition: Supported or established by evidence or proof.:Marked by a tendency to spread especially into healthy tissue.:An infection caused by eukaryotic heterotrophic organisms that live as saprobes or parasites, including mushrooms, yeasts, smuts, molds, etc. They reproduce either sexually or asexually, and have life cycles that range from simple to complex. Filamentous fungi refer to those that grow as multicellular colonies (mushrooms and molds).

Concepts.definition: Support or establish by evidence or proof.
Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.
An infection caused by a fungus.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unk ND NA Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes, no, unknown, not done or not applicable.
